website_summaries.verdict: The best manual lawn coring aerator for a simple but effective way of maintaining the yard.
pros: Long cores dig deep into the soil, creating a 1/2" hole with each push
The large foot plate makes it easy to push the aerator into tough and dry soil
Reduces runoff and promotes turf growth
37" height is easy on the back
cons: Clay-like soil and mud can clog the aeration holes when aerating a wet lawn

customer_reviews.title: Worked well... and then kept clogging
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions and put my sprinkler on prior to using this. I was surprised how easily I was able to get this into the ground as I only weigh 100 pounds. However, after the first two rows of working flawlessly, it started to clog every few steps. I'm not sure if the soil became more clay-like or what but I really slowed down because I had to keep cleaning out the coring pieces. Because of this, I didn't get a lot of the cores to the top which I was hoping for to improve nutrition to the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for small yards at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2, 2014 I've used this product twice on my front yard. Once in April 2014 and again in March 2016. One of the tines has started to bend. It seems like the weld joint has partially failed. I plan to tack it back in place and fill it but I wanted to post photos before I do so. If your yard is bigger than mine you probably want to pursue a faster option. This tool works very well for small yards without the hassles of power equipment. The price is fantastic. Tip: Clean all of the soil out of both of the bores once finished.
customer_reviews.author: NewHomeOwner

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn't work, piece of junk, horrible design
customer_reviews.text: I had to stop my aerating and sit down to write this review. Such was my level of frustration. Watered my lawn and began aerating. About every 4 plunges, one or both of the hollow prongs would become clogged. I would then have to sit down and patiently remove the dirt with a screwdriver. Mind you the unclogging was difficult as heck. So after about 45 minutes I had spent 3-5 minutes actually aerating and 40 minutes unclogging this aerator. So it's really a glorified 2 prong garden fork. I have bought a zillion things on amazon but this has to be the most frustrating, useless item of all. I suspect some reviewers have been compensated for their 'opinions'.
customer_reviews.author: gefra

customer_reviews.title: This thing is worthless
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of using a simple tool like this to aerate a small yard instead of renting/hauling a machine or paying to have it done. This tool is NOT it. I could not get this tool to pull a plug under any condition--wet, dry, or any number of ground moisture levels in between!! It simply clogged up. I made holes in the yard, but the tool just was just compacting the turf below the hole. I could do that with a pitchfork or a piece of rebar. Don't waste your money or time on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T McKay

customer_reviews.title: It is a sturdy product but even with following the instructions the holes ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a sturdy product but even with following the instructions the holes get plugged about every third time you push it into the ground. You spend more time trying to unplug it than actually aerating the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: clay rogers

customer_reviews.title: Maximum Effort
customer_reviews.text: Nothing was ever been so hard to use and so pointless. It clogs every step. I read the reviews, so made sure soil wasn't too wet or too dry. A screw driver works to unclog it, but it takes a lot longer so i ended up walking around the yard with a cordless drill with a bit deep enough get the job done (the unclogging, not the aeration) So. Much. No.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Clogs easily. Snaps at handle weld if you use side to side motion.
customer_reviews.text: Ive gone through two of these in about two hours. I ordered two because I figured it would save time stopping to unclog. Problem is, first one died before clogging became an issue - it snapped right where the handle meets the tines at what I imagine is a bad weld. The second jammed up badly and after unclogging it with water it never recovered. These are made of a soft metal so they distend easily. Once they become misshapen at all they will clog over and over and over again. So, I went ahead and accepted replacements but I dont have much hope for this brand - at least not in our rather compacted and gritty soil.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Lawn aerator seems to work well, good heavy duty construction
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have very hard soli, but if I water it first, then I can do a pretty good job poking holes with this tool. It's a bit of a workout, which is fine. I bought the other kind of aerator as well, the one that "cores" and the dirt plugs come out of the top. I like them both, and I think there is a use for either, depending on what you're trying to accomplish. I had previously tried those spike shoes, and those didn't work AT ALL, so this is a much better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Bulie

customer_reviews.title: Tedious work
customer_reviews.text: Well it's cheaper than the aerating machine. It definitely improved drainage where I used it. Can't say I noticed it helping in any other way. It worked fairly well. There were some particularly compacted areas that this thing just couldn't penetrate. They had to be worked loose with a garden fork. Several times it would jam with a small rock and I'd have to try to clear it out. It's not great, but it's not bad. If you can't be bothered to rent an aerator, and you don't mind tediously going over your lawn with this thing for a good long while, then...................there you go.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schaible

customer_reviews.title: Better than mechanical version to save your lawn
customer_reviews.text: I love my yard butler aerator. It’s definitely going to last a long time. My only problem with it is it gets clogged and requires unplugging it. You must turn it upside down to do this. I have a steel giant screw driver (rod) almost the diameter of the holes and it works ok. I think the yard butler should come with something to do this. I aerated over 1000 square feet and it really helped my compacted lawn. The manual method is harder but you don’t tear up your lawn like you would with an electric one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazn Artist

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with mud
customer_reviews.text: When the tool works right, it is great for cutting into the lawn and creating plugs but if the dirt gets jammed in the tube, it is not easy to take the core out of the tube. I had to use a screw driver, a stick, anything I could find try and break up the dirt. It took way too long to aerate my lawn due to it jamming all the time. I still like it but it can be a pain to work with. Make sure the water is really wet and the water has soaked into the dirt for a while or any dry lawn will definitely jam the tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Contreras

customer_reviews.title: perfect tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium sized yard and did not want to pay $100.00 to have my yard aerated. I waited until after there was a significant rainfall so my water bill wouldn't increase by saturating the lawn and then I used the tool. It worked beautifully. I had to put in the work, but it saved me money and I got to workout in the meantime. Its easy to use once you get a good pace going. I kept my foot inside when I lifted it out of the ground and moved to the next spot. I would highly recommend for small and medium sized lawns where aeration is needed.
customer_reviews.author: MissV

customer_reviews.title: It works, but be patient.
customer_reviews.text: First, let me start by saying if you don’t have a sprinkler system, I wouldn’t put myself through the headache of using this tool unless I had a very small yard. Just hire someone or rent a gas powered unit. I waited to use this until after a heavy rain overnight and I still ended up having to run my sprinklers to prevent the cores from getting plugged. I had to regularly clean, wipe, and oil the cores every so often to encourage them to not clog up. Once the lawn was waaaaaay oversaturated, the clogging occurred much less and the job was more tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H

customer_reviews.title: Better than renting a machine
customer_reviews.text: I was able to aerate my entire 7,000-square-foot lawn with this in probably a total of 4-5 hours, which seems like a lot, but I did it over the course of a few days, and when you factor in the time it takes to go rent and pick up a machine, it seemed about equal to me. The real plus of this, however, was that it could get into tight places a machine could not, so I was able to do a more thorough job. And I have it on hand for the fall or for when I see areas that need a touch-up. Best $30-$35 I've spent on a yard tool!
customer_reviews.author: BKK Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to use on our year old lawn. The plugs of dirt and sod keep coming up and out of the top holes as you keep pushing down on different areas of the lawn. Watch out for the underground pipes, though. I pick up the plugs and toss them out so the lawn still looks nice. You can hardly tell there are awesome holes just ready to capture water for the roots of your lawn. You won't be compacting and smashing down your lawn with this awesome gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Skyway Shoppers

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely obsessed with my Yard Butler! My soil is compacted clay, it had no grass, nothing green. Just a few patches of thatch that were white and dead. (I wish I had taken “before” pics but I didnt😢) Now I have new grass and clovers popping up! The clay is softer and workable. I’ve been using the Yard Butler for maybe a a couple weeks now. I can’t believe the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this aerator. I dont have the budget to purchase a gas powered aerator and the nearest rental location that has one is over 100 miles away. I ordered this and was able to use it right out of the box. We had rain several days ago and I was easily able to penetrate the soil. I have a good size yard so I plan to do a little each time I am outside. I am over 200 lbs and this seems very sturdy. It doesn't seem unbreakable but if you have alot of resistance then I would push it too far. Great product, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Does work but tired to do so
customer_reviews.text: Year ago, we usually asked gardener to help aeration but this year we want to try ourselves. So I bought this coring aerator and learned from YouTube video. I have to say this aerator need certain strength to insert them into the lawn. My husband can do the work easily but not me even I water the lawn before working. We finished the whole backyard in 4 days (1 hour each day), because it’s really a hard work. Anyway, the tool works.
customer_reviews.author: Tina L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for small yard!
customer_reviews.text: Never AGAIN will I try and use this to do all 5500+ square feet of my front yard. But even when I wore out, this thing didn't. It endured rocks and my constant weight without any sign of wear. As others have stated, the wetter the ground the better. And definitely plan on soaking it in water to make sure what is in there doesn't dry and clog it up. If you have a small yard or just want to hit the corners and difficult spots that a larger aerator missed, this is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Adam/Allison Scott

customer_reviews.title: Clogging issue solved!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had one before and returned it because once side always clogged. Bought a new one this year in hopes it wasnt defective. It was. One side would always clog right away. Turns out there is a quality control problem that is easily fixed with a file. There is a weld joint on the tops on the tubes that catch the soil and cause impaction to occur. Get a file and file that weld down on both tube. You wont clog again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Purdin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small lawns - if you water first
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I want to do with it. Do yourself a favor and either wait for a day after lots of rain, or water the lawn thoroughly before trying to do this. I was able to aerate my small (20 ft x 20 ft) lawn in about an hour, including some breaks. The aerator clogged a couple of times in a dry spot, but was great in the well watered places. Be prepared for a bit of a workout and wear very sturdy shoes/boots. Carry a screwdriver to clear out clogs. This is a well designed and built tool overall. I always felt solid and secure while I was using it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Miller

customer_reviews.title: but this is a very bad design. Only one hole works at a time ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, but this is a very bad design. Only one hole works at a time and you have to constantly clean it. The holes should have been cut differently, with the point on the inside––as it's pictured. Instead, the pointed hole is to the front so you have to put hard pressure there.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis McGillis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build quality, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: i used on small 10' x 10' patch in my front yard which was affected by soil compaction and lesser sunlight. i used this to aerate the soil. Easy to use (only when the soil is well soaked with water). Was able to get the job done and a month later (of course with some fertilizer and watering) the patch is green. Whilst fertilizer was applied earlier without aerating, but this time I believe aerating it did the trick. Easy to use tool, with one note about cleaning, it is a bit tricky to get the Texas clay soil that cakes into the holes, even after 24 hours of soaking in water, it is tricky.
customer_reviews.author: crm_guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Did my whole lawn. Works great didnt break after 3 hours of use. Had to stop a couple times to knock small stones out. No big deal. Just used a large screw driver to tap on it. Sometimes to pry out a stone. Got a helluva work out. Use when the lawn is wet well. Or you may regret trying this method and end up calling a landscaper. I saved 300 bucks not using a landscaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: If You Aren't Allergic Strenuous Work - You Will Love This Product
customer_reviews.text: This item is built to last and does the job it was designed to do. The only difficulty I experienced was when a small pebble clogged one of the tines. - easily removes with a screw driver. The cores that are extracted are uniform and will tell you a lot about the composition of your soil. I previously rented power aerators and prefer the result from this product. Power aeration is much easier but it is harder on existing turf. The Butler Aerator extracts the cores 180 degrees vertical with no tearing of the existing turf. I can to say enough good things about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an aeration tool and don't want to rent the machine or have someone do it, this is what you are looking for. If you have a small to medium sized yard, you will not have any problem using this on your lawn. The best part is that you can do it as much as you want. I just did it so I can't explain any results, but I can see the plug holes in the yard and the yard is aerated. If this doesn't work I likely have someone else going on in my yard, not related to any aeration or problem with this tool. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with sturdiness/quality
customer_reviews.text: Although I just got it, I'm impressed by the quality construction at this pricepoint, hard to find in these days of made in china junky tools. I think most of the bad reviews are about expectations from the users. This design is not perfect. I have tried different methods in our clay lawn: the spikes on shoes, pitchforks, shovels and by far this tool works best. Compared to a traditional fork, which is what I was using, it is superior in every way. I can see how it would clog if the soil is too muddy but again it works fine for me. We'll see about durability.
customer_reviews.author: Zinn_Chomsky_Seeger

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once, but it works pretty well! I aerated my whole yard in 20 minutes. Sometimes dirt can get clogged, especially if there's little rocks. You really need to water your lawn pretty well a little bit before you use this thing. But, if you do this thing works like a charm. Before buying this aerator, I used a pitchfork to punch holes in the lawn. But that is not true aeration and doesn't really help the lawn that much. Occasional clocking is inevitable. Just put a screwdriver in your pocket while you aerate.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory C. Poe

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the performance.
customer_reviews.text: After using it for a while, I was surprised by how well it ejected the plugs from the lawn. I first thought "why did I buy this item when Lowe's had a cheaper brand that seemed better built." Well let me tell you that for some reason, the Yard Butler aerator just works better. I had planned to return this one, but after using it for half the yard, I'm returning the one from Lowes. The Corona brand from Lowes seems to be built stronger, but clogs often. The Yard Butler just worked better though the shaft did seem to flex a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: kf

customer_reviews.title: This one actually works in my clay soil!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Great deal at $25 and free Prime shipping. Only clogged twice in 5000 sq. feet yard with lots of clay soil. It actually clogged when it broke off a chunk of tree root and the 2nd time on a chunk of rock. That's my yard's fault, not the Yard Butler. Well designed, in that the passage gets wider after the initial 1⁄2" inch of the core, making it easy for the cores to get ejected on their own. -LOVE IT! Before I had a Hound Dog version of this from AMES and it was unusable. So glad I found this, my lawn is now finally aerated!
customer_reviews.author: PhilT

customer_reviews.title: Needs provement
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great for a small yard and it works fairly well however it needs some improvement . Too many amps used in the welding process, therefore over penetrating the inside, causing restriction of the plugs. Had to get my grinder out and grind all that excess weld out of the inside and also it wasn't sharp enough I had to sharpen the points to penetrate the ground easier. I would increase the taper a few more degrees, to help the plugs come out easier. all in all it's a good idea but the quality must improve.
customer_reviews.author: mitchiselvis

customer_reviews.title: Want to aerate your lawn without renting a machine?
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, I LOVE this! Make sure your lawn is nice and wet before and when using. Especially if your lawn is sandy or clay like as it's too hard to for the tool to be inserted in the ground. This happens with machine aerators as well, you just don't notice it because you aren't the one physically pushing it in. I got this tool because I didn't want to spend $60-$100 to rent an aeration machine when I could purchase this and use it year after year. As long as your yard is nice and wet, it's pretty quick and easy to get through.
customer_reviews.author: EC Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. I fully expected this to get packed with dirt and not work well. I've only done about 200 square feet so far but it works great. The plugs come out the top easily. You definitely need to make sure you clean all the dirt out when you're finished or it will get packed in there pretty solid. An old screwdriver has worked pretty well for cleaning it. Only suggestion would be to put 1 or 2 spikes between the cores so you get the spike aeration on each step as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great aerator!!
customer_reviews.text: We get a strong wind in the afternoon that dries out the top of the lawn so I have been looking for an aerator that works well. This is it. Have used it several time on my front and back yards. Doesn’t clog which is great. Leaves a nice sized hole for watering effectively. Only downside it that one of prongs bent slightly on a root. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Guinn

customer_reviews.title: Easy alternative to hiring a professional
customer_reviews.text: As those below have said. Make sure your ground is damp. I ran the sprinklers for about 10 mins prior to starting. It was extremely easy to use my only complaint is that I wish the bar was a bit longer. My back started to hurt by the end. Other than that great product that makes easy work of a tedious task
customer_reviews.author: Bhan

customer_reviews.title: it does work but its not easy
customer_reviews.text: The tubes get clogged very easily and if you don't have a tool long enough to clear out the holes then you're in for a challenge. The item in general comes with a lot of hurdles. Your lawn has to be the correct wetness or you won't be able to lift up the dirt from your lawn. It is very time consuming and patience is required if the tubes keep getting clogged. This is a great workout if you want to be optimistic. IMO this product isn't worth 35 bucks. I would've been happier at 20.
customer_reviews.author: jeffro

customer_reviews.title: Makes Holes and Is NOT a Core Aerator
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make holes in my grass and apply Myco+ to the roots. This is not a core aerator, it simply makes holes 3 to 4" deep. Of course it is slow going, its not a machine. I have a compacted lawn area that I wanted to treat with Myco+ (root stimulant), but Myco plus needs to get to the roots. Started with the Yard Butler and then liquid treated lawn with Myco+ and Miracle-Gro crystals. Mixed in a bucket and poured on lawn and soaked into holes made by tool, Very sturdy, very durable. Well built.
customer_reviews.author: waltbobjr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small lawn
customer_reviews.text: I finally have the time to manually aerate our small lawn and thought this is an economical tool to make lawn care a DIY this year. I am pleased with my first use of the tool in that it is sturdy, appears durable and was definitely easy to use. The soil was very compact, but after watering, it was easy to aerate manually. After the job, it was easy to clean as well. This saves me paying for aeration from a lawn care service and was an easy and enjoyable task to do on a small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Sick of shoes in the hall

customer_reviews.title: You know what they say about big feet, right?
customer_reviews.text: I you have a large foot or wear big boots while aerating, you might have a hard time inserting it in the designated pushing area. My size 14 barely fit. Otherwise, the tool functions okay, except one side always gets clogged and I need to use a power drill to clear the jam. Not sure why each side doesn’t clear consistently. Perhaps the sod was too wet. I’ll have to try when it’s a bit drier. Lifetime warranty is a bonus, but I hope I don’t need to invoke the coverage.
customer_reviews.author: hirez

customer_reviews.title: Consider before buying
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this product would work as I had expected, but ran into problems. First, the crossmember is situated so that during use it slams against the leg of the user, causing pain and discomfort, especially a given the constant repetition required to use such a tool Next, I noticed that, unlike some other handheld plug aerators, this unit torque during use. That said, it would seem that the additional movement would lead ultimately to additional wear over time.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrythere

customer_reviews.title: Great work out tool
customer_reviews.text: Works great... till it clogs. Every little rock seemed to clog one side or the other up. If you don’t have rocks in your lawn your golden, if you do then have a large spike ready to constantly unclog. Honestly though it’s a great work out of you like being outdoors and working in your lawn
customer_reviews.author: ItsJustMe

customer_reviews.title: A lot of punch in a well built, durable and nicely priced package.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as an alternative to hiring a yard service to a aerate our 1600 square foot area of grass. After soaking the ground a day prior and allowing the soil to moisten thoroughly, we were able to aerate the yard without issue. As a matter of fact, the product worked beyond expectation - no clogging, easy to maneuver and operate, very durable and solidly built. After we aerated our yard, we marched over to the neighbor’s house and took care of her grassy area. We highly recommend this product for anyone looking to aerate small to medium sized areas of grass.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Oddly satisfying
customer_reviews.text: We bought this handy tool in efforts to save our lawn. My husband watered the lawn for four hours prior to using the tool. You just step on it and out comes a fresh, perfectly cylindrical core. It’s like popping a black head, if you enjoy those odd videos. I used the tool all over my lawn. Since I just did this today, I am not sure of the outcome. The tool is sturdy, has nice soft hand grips and came fully assembled. Since it is all metal, I am sure it will last a few years. I have thought of just aerating my neighborhood, because I find this oddly satisfying to use.
customer_reviews.author: ShannBbb

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I did not need a bucket of water
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I did not need a bucket of water, or a screwdriver, or to sand the inside, or any other adjustment that was recommended in other reviews. There were a couple times where plugs did not come out of the top, but the hole had been made, so I just continued on. The tool never got plugged up. Eventually the plugs came out of the top. I just kept going along. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: K8suggs

customer_reviews.title: My husband is making me write this review
customer_reviews.text: So my husband was looking for one of these and was looking at ones for 65.00. I found this one on Amazon for way cheaper and ordered it based on all the positive reviews. My husband loves it and it is way better than he expected for the price. He actually admitted I was right to order this for the price and was glad the reviews were honest about this product. So...it is not often a man admits his wife is right.....so had to write this review....would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and solid.
customer_reviews.text: I have tough soil. Make sure to use after it rains and/or with a hose to get the soil very wet. It will make it so much easier. I sometimes use it like a javelin in hard spots. In the beginning it would clog, but i think after using it and after some paint comes off, the tool works pretty easily into the soil. I found a groove, it's quiet and its exercise. I did my 6000 square foot lawn in my spare time. This particular tool is strong and simple construction.
customer_reviews.author: bh

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it does, but has a flaw that is easily fixed
customer_reviews.text: This Aerator works fairly well, however, depending on how compacted the soil is, the soil does not come out of the top of the holes. I sprayed silicone spray into the holes prior to inserting into the soil and this makes a big difference. Now I have "plugs" all over my lawn where before the silicone spray , I just had holes. Soil type: South Texas Sand and Clay mix. Other than this, product is sturdy and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: christopher nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Tool
customer_reviews.text: If your soil is "just right", not too dry nor too wet, the tool works great! Plugs get ejected out of the top as expected. The tool itself is sturdy, it hasn't bent yet and the welds appear to be holding strong. Only the coating of paint has worn off on the prongs. This device will help me maintain the high traffic areas throughout the year. I'm very pleased with this purchase, so far. I'll update the review if that changes.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Goldfuss

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different products like sprays of aeriation and the shoes for aeration. They did not work very well. I was looking for a tool that I could easily use (age 49 female) to aerate my lawn. This tool The Butler works great, easy to use, fairly light weight ... you just need to saturate/wet the grass really well before use and the soil pops right thru the hole. If the dirt/soil/grass/rocks get stuck just poke it with a screwdriver and it pops out. Highly recommend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Good core aerator, be sure to water the lawn first!
customer_reviews.text: This product is quite easy to use. Just make sure the soil is wet and you will have an easy time. A way you can check is by using a screwdriver and sticking it in all the way. If it does not go in easy and out, then water the soil more and try again. Sometimes a core doesn't go up the first time, keep using it until you the soil come up from the ends, its beautiful once you get the flow down. Big tip: Find a bucket and a long and nice screw driver for when it gets stuck. It makes it much easier to clean out!
customer_reviews.author: Kami-sama!

customer_reviews.title: Wear your gloves!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it's supposed to, just wear your gloves. I did about 2000 sq ft with this thing and I peeled my hands off twice. Probably should have rented a machine, but what can I say, I like doing thing the hard way. And FYI I gave one star for ease of use because although it is SIMPLE, push it in, pull it out (shutup,) it is not easy. It starts out so, but after you've done 10 ft or so, it gets...well, not so easy. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: The tool itself is good, just be careful of defected ones and double charging you
customer_reviews.text: Although the first one I got is a defected one, I am very happy with the second one they sent to me. The first one was always clogged one side. The second one worked fine. If your lawn is small, this is a good tool for you. P.s. they double charged me said I did not return my first one which I already sent, at last they refunded to me, so that is fine, just a little bit annoyed. So if you are unfortunate like me need to return the first defected one, please remember to check your card to see if they double charge you or not.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Tsui

customer_reviews.title: Perfect aerator for a small yard
customer_reviews.text: This is my second aerator. I left the first at my previous home. This little tool is great for aerating a small yard. I have about 300 Sq. Ft of back yard I use this in. The tines are long enough to reach below the base lair of grass soil and into the clay so common here in Virginia Beach. Because the tines are hollow, instead of compacting the ground to create a hole it actually removes a plug. Add a little compost or peat moss and will help maintain a healthy lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If it helped my yard it can help yours too.
customer_reviews.text: Brought my dirt to life so grass could once again grow AND no more large puddles of water either. Yay! My yard was VERY neglected and dirt compacted from people parking on it and years without fertilizer (we rent). This changed everything! Grass is finally starting to grow and even the trees look happier. Use after a hard rain. Do NOT use on a dry lawn - that will make it a miserable experience. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is sturdy, and punches the holes in damp lawn. Per advice in many reviews for this item, I've liberally watered the lawn a night before, and was able to easily core the soil. In some spots the soil was too dry, so I watered those areas again and tried the tool the next day - with success. I like it, but I wish it had an angle or something - it is a straight tool and requires some getting used to when applying the pressure with foot.
customer_reviews.author: DanielBDavis

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: The product is very sturdy. The handle and body are solid metal. It has a nice hammerite like finish. My only small issue with it is that the plugs do not always come out of the tool. It is hard to tell if soil is being pushed into the device or if it's just being pushed to the side. If your soil is really compacted you may want to carry around a tool to push the plugs out every now and then. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Augenstein

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, unless (like my wife who I love and adore) you step on the holes while you are attempting to aerate... If you do that, do not get mad at your husband who tries to provide you instructions to not do that. It's not his fault, ok. If the tubes do get plugged, the easiest way to unplug them is to bang the sides with a large screw driver to loosen the plugs.
customer_reviews.author: jascotx

customer_reviews.title: Deducted a star due to the spikes clogging too easy and being too hard to clear when they are ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Deducted a star due to the spikes clogging too easy and being too hard to clear when they are clogged. They should've included some sort of a tool for clearing clogs. One thing to keep in mind wash after every use and spray some lubricant (wd-40 or similar) to keep it from rusting. I've noticed others have complained about the stick braking off I can see this happening with improper use I has make sure to drive the tool straight down and straight up. Don't try to wiggle it or put force on it sideways when it's in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: M-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't core properly.
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. Bought this because I have never aerated my lawn. Saw this on a YouTube video. Looked like it would fit the bill. The only thing that happened was the cores got stuck in the tines. Followed suggestions of making sure lawn was moist. That didn't help either. Next time I'll just go rent the aeration machine like I was planning on. Save your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty small yard so figured I didn't need much for aeration and gave this a shot. It definitely works best after the lawn is watered. Otherwise it can be pretty tough to get it in all the way. It did seem like it flexed/bent a little some when the yard wasn't quite soft enough. I don't think it's in any danger of breaking, but I worry about the longevity of it. Hopefully it holds up for a few years. It definitely seemed to help the lawn after I used it though.
customer_reviews.author: RF9928

customer_reviews.title: Aereator - Fantastic Tool!
customer_reviews.text: This aereator is a fantastic tool for hard soil. Our soil is clay, and it's difficult to establish good drainage and to help water reach grass roots. This well-made tool has been a game-changer. I am so grateful to have found it! It's easy to use and the grass where we have used it is much healthier now. It's actually possible to treat the yard in one area and not get the level of run-off that we saw before.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Libre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: A great option for small yards, or steep hills. I was able to do my entire yard (it's pretty small) in about an hour and a half. My only issue is that the plugs didn't seem to always come out, or wereuch smaller than the depth at which the aerator was going into the ground. That may have been a result of the moisture levels in the soil (or user error) though. I'll give it about her run in the spring and update
customer_reviews.author: Deep

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. I have hard clay soil that is somewhat compacted. I was able to step on this and it went into the ground easily when soil was a little dam. It might be tougher to use on super dry clay soil, but haven't tried that. Spikes have a slight tendency to collect a little dirt/mud but just remove it every once and a while as you go along and it's no trouble. Would have preferred a slightly longer handle, but that's a minor issue. Have used only once thus far, but seems to be durable and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: fleastoo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a smaller yard
customer_reviews.text: This tool is perfect for our hard clay soil Arizona backyard. While trading effort for cost, this also allows greater flexibility, like getting into smaller places between sprinkler lines and flower beds, than do even the smallest of machines or rollers. It's sturdy, durable, and easy enough to use, once you learn to rock it, and I consider it a worthy addition to my purposefully small number of specific outdoor tools. I seldom recommend anything but, this one is easy enough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cultural_Artifacts

customer_reviews.title: Saves money.
customer_reviews.text: Very good took for manual adoration. Saves a lot of money. You need to have some fitness in order to use it. Takes 2 hours for my lawn so I do it in patches. Make sure that ground is wet and soft or do it after a good rain
customer_reviews.author: desert fox

customer_reviews.title: Physical Labor Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool takes physical labor. It has a sturdy feel to it, but I wouldn't over do pressure. The soil must be moist in order for tbe dirt to slide throw the holes. I tried dry soil and it clogged up. All in all, good product.
customer_reviews.author: RES

customer_reviews.title: Manual labor for sure, but worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy manual labor as a mind-cleansing exercise. If you are lookin for “easy work” to aerate, this may not be it. I highly recommend water saturating your lawn prior to use. Once I fully soaked the grass, it got much easier to use and works as designed. I did have to stop and clear rocks a few times, so keep an ice pick handy. Overall, completely worth the cost and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mooresn

customer_reviews.title: Clog city over here
customer_reviews.text: It clogs and clogs and clogs some more. It's easy enough to use but it clogs all the time. I water the lawn and use it and it clogs. I have to stop and take out the clogs. It clogs again. Repeat..... I'm average sized and female so this was easy enough to use. It either clogs frequently or in very wet ground sludge just comes through. There was no real happy point.
customer_reviews.author: Winston&co

customer_reviews.title: New happy owner
customer_reviews.text: First time user here! This was really easy to use after, as commented by others, I watered my lawn. Cleaning was a breast after I dunked it in a water bucket for a couple hours. Keep in mind that you will need to work for your lunch with this tool :) I’m looking forward to the results over the next few weeks. I’ll post back if I see any issues with the tool or anything else noteworthy
customer_reviews.author: book worm 834

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR SMALL AREAS THAT REQUIRE AERATION
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use in a small area between the street and the sidewalk on our standard suburban sized lot, where we needed more drainage. My husband used this after we got a good soaking rain, and it was a breeze to use. He is very very happy with it. If you have a larger area to aerate, you would probably like one that has more than two tubes on it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I'm overall very pleased with the performance of the tool. I have 3/4 acre and rent a powered aerator. However, I use this to touch up some areas where the grass struggles to take. I used on pretty well soaked ground and worked quite well. I wish the main vertical bar was a little stiffer - sometimes you hit a hard spot and want to wiggle back and forth a bit and the bar bends a lot. Also, the rubber handles should have been glued on since they tend to slip.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmerchic

customer_reviews.title: Works well, and feels strong
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, conveniently placed holes on the sides. It clogs up but you just keep going and eventually it pops the dirt out. I have too large of a yard for this, which I realized when doing it for 1 hour and quit there. I guess if you want a good workout it would be nice, but even this well designed tool doesn't make core aerating a large lawn a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Ari S.

customer_reviews.title: ... problems with one of the tines getting plugged constantly like other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: Ive had some problems with one of the tines getting plugged constantly like other reviewers. I usually have to carry a screwdriver with me to unclog it during use. For the price, it's annoying but usable for me. 3 1/2 stars. Update: I ended up tossing this. Both times started getting plugged up, and it was a pain to stop every 4 to 5 steps to push the dirt out with a screwdriver. I really wanted this to work, but will end up just paying someone to do it next year.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Decent core aerator for small yard
customer_reviews.text: Used the yard butler coring aerator a couple of times on my small yard. I didn’t have problems with it clogging but I waited until the ground was moist but not overly so. Soil conditions are pretty important. Anyhow, I thought it was fun at first but after awhile, it really felt like hard work and my yard isn’t big! I wouldn’t recommend this for a large area unless you have a lot of time and energy. It did a decent job on my small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Karend

customer_reviews.title: Well made manual aerator-works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great manual lawn aerator. Makes 3” deep holes. Best in soft soil. Forget the aeration shoes they’re terrible imo. This manual aerator is well made with powder coated finish. When the ground is soft I found I can move through the lawn very quickly. Best probably for lawn repair areas. Seeds fall into the holes. Combine with seed starter and water 2x a day. Gold.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need to put make those holes in the ground for your grass.
customer_reviews.text: I looked around until I saw this one. It's a solid tool to have. Easy to use and made those hole you see on professionally maintained grass parks and stuff. With those little tubes of earth that pop out. It's so well-made I will probably never need to get another one, so I'll keep an eye on this brand as it seems to be a good one. I did my whole backyard in about 25 minutes. It was fun.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. I wasn't sure how well something like this ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I wasn't sure how well something like this would really work, but it did great. I did under estimate the size of my front yard and it took longer than expected, but it did pay for it's self after the first use. Just make sure the lawn is moist when using and keep a long screw driver with you in case rocks get stuck to tubes, then you're in business. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Patric Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small lawn!
customer_reviews.text: We have small front and backyard lawns, and the professional aerators cannot service our backyard because the entry gate is too narrow. So...I thought I'd aerate the lawn myself. This unit is easy to use and efficiently gets the job done. The ground needs to be damp, so it's best to do the aeration after rain or running the sprinklers.
customer_reviews.author: DebNoCo

customer_reviews.title: I'm a believer
customer_reviews.text: This is a review from very heavy clay soil. I was going to write a bad review on the product because I was getting no plugs. Like other reviewers have said, you have to water or moisten the grass before you start plugging. So after a big rain, I was hesitant to start plugging fearing a muddy mess but to my surprise, I started pulling up plugs! There were no plugs when I aerated on a dry lawn. Much easier when its wet also. I did the machine gun technique where I did not use my foot for leverage. much faster and a great workout! I'm keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pokes holes, that's all.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, I'm returning it. It clogs immediately, "cores" do not eject. I tried everything, watered the lawn, (no clay soil here) polished inside the tubes w/320 & 640 grit paper. (smoother in there than the finish on my car!) I've read that poking round holes in the lawn compacts the soil more, worse than doing nothing. Off to Home Depot to rent a machine, do it right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm if your soil has the correct moisture level
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I was able to "easily" aerate my grass. Make sure you soil is not too dry, or too wet. It's a bit of an exercise, even for small areas. Kids here aerate for not much, but I installed my sprinkler system myself and the pipes are not too deep. For a careful aeration, this is the best approach. As you get the hang of it, you'll be able to go without stopping using your right (or left) foot fixed on top of it. Takes a little bit of practice.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Useless for making plugs
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, you spend more time trying to clear it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Jenest

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great - It digs into moist soil easily. However, using for even 10 minutes is pretty tough (mostly because I am out of shape). Would definitely recommend for those who have smaller sized yards.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: The quality is 10/10!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great for small to medium areas. It is amazingly sturdy and well built and you kind of hop along the lawn and make the core holes pretty easily. I did an area of about 500 feet in about 15 minutes so I suppose you could do 2000 sq feet in an hour so long as the ground wasn't very hard and mine wasn't. This is a tool to keep for a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself money and sweat a bit
customer_reviews.text: Love it works as described. Ensure you water well or do it day after rain which worked great for me. It took less than 2 hours for a 5000 sqft yard. Keep your foot inside the tool and pull out. Look straight so your neck doesn't hurt and keep moving step by step. I have back pain but this task following the mentioned steps didn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Bala

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Worked with much less effort than expected. I have a lot of red clay, and it worked great. Do yourself a favor and only use it after a good rainstorm or after using your sprinklers. Can't go through thick tree roots or rocks, but neither can the big machine core aerators. In addition to using it on my lawn, I'm also using it around various other ornamentals and ground covers.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Worley

customer_reviews.title: If really compacted dirt hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it is lightweight and when the soil is med to soft it works really well. However, I have never aerated my lawn in 20 years so the dirt is super compact which makes it hard to push in the ground. I have to clean it each time since the compacted dirt stays in the prong instead of push out every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: JAW

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Tool
customer_reviews.text: I've tried using this thing in dry conditions, wet conditions, and mild conditions. Works poorly in every instance. So frustrating. Clogs after the third plunge. I hate to leave a bad review, but I would not recommend this to anyone unless you're buying it for decorative purposes only. To get the job done, I had to clear the tool's aerating pipes with a screwdriver constantly. It just clogs up and pierces the ground without aerating. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Johanson

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this tool
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this lawn tool. Did a small portion of the lawn and one side became clogged. I cleared out the dirt that was in there and it immediately became clogged again. I washed it out and had same result. Immediately gets clogged so I am only getting half of the desired holes in the lawn. I followed instructions to water lawn prior and it had rained the night before, the lawn should have been wet enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: only works on one side
customer_reviews.text: Just got aerator today and used it first time. Only one side of aerator will push lawn plug up and through top of tine. other side just gets plugged and won't work. Have cleared multiple times put only the one side will work. I noticed that the bottom of plug that won't work is a little mis-shaped. Really expected more after ready good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kroman

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Product is fantastic and easy to use. Some dirt is a bit hard at my place so I have to wiggle the tool down into the ground and in doing so my knees sometimes knock on the metal shaft. But other than that, this product is great and would recommend. As for the plugs getting clogged with dirt, I use a screwdriver or Allen wrench to poke it through.
customer_reviews.author: Norton family

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This thing did a pretty good job. I found the most important thing was to have the ground at the right level of wetness. Too dry and it was very hard to aerate, and material would get stuck inside. Too wet and it would just “poke” into the ground without actually lifting out a core. If you get this right, this unit works well and seems pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: computernut236

customer_reviews.title: Poor design - doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same design as when formerly made in the USA. Looks very similar but the tubes are formed differently. The cores stick in the tubes with the current design. I was able to make a side by side comparison in the same soil conditions with my friends USA model. His works perfectly and is a pleasure to use. This model is useless. Hope the company pays attention and returns to the original design. HR
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a medium sized suburban lawn. We get a lot of rain so the ground was wet when I used it. Worked great. Pulled out about 3 inch plugs with every push. Sometimes the tubes would clog but it wasn't too bad. We will see if it holds up but it seems to be pretty well made. I would definitely recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: TheAlf

customer_reviews.title: Works best after a day of rain, does not work well with dry, compacted clay. Not sharp enough.
customer_reviews.text: Feels a bit flimsy in build quality, but mine has not broken yet. Impossible to poke any holes in dry clay. Manual says water area thoroughly before using, but when in a drought and have decent sized lawn, makes sense to rent gas powered aerator that will do a better job, less time and more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Aerator
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona and just did my winter grass. This Aerator is perfect! So satisfying to see it work like it is supposed to. The holes are the perfect size. I bought a green painted one last year that had about 5 holes from a different manufacturer and the holes were too small so they only clogged up with dirt. Spend the few extra bucks on this one; it is totally worth it. TIP: make sure to have to long part of the angled edge close to you; this helps get perfect sized cores every time. Also, make sure your lawn is plenty wet before you start.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: High quality material; great for small yards
customer_reviews.text: The metal is sturdy and has a texture to it. Used this with moist soil and was still able to get the dirt out. Trick is to just move on to the next set of holes, the new dirt will push the old dirt out. You'll then have to rinse it out with a hose, but the dirt come out easily. The handles are nice with a good soft grip.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, effective
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, very effective. After rain, I used this for the first time, and absolutely satisfied. As land softened by rain, it is piece of cake to step on it, and proceed just normal walking, and pile of soil is pulled out automatically. Will see how this effective aeration improve my lawn condition.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Chang Kim

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: Great for spot applications. Does a great job and is well built tool that could be considered for heirloom status. This is of the same quality of how the older tools were made. It has a simplistic design and Is simple to maintain. The plugs come right out as you press down and hole are fairly deep. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: P J

customer_reviews.title: uneven bore
customer_reviews.text: One of the bore has an excess welding spot inside the bore. It prevents the core from coming out easily. Every 2 core i did , I have to stop and force the dirt out of the bore before I can continue. This make coring very slow and tedious . Wish you guys had not shipped this before the quality control phase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Yard Butler Lawn Coring Aerator Manual Grass Dethatching Turf Plug Core Aeration Tool ID-6C
product_meta.description: Style:Coring AeratorThe Yard Butler Lawn Coring Aerator revitalizes old lawns while using less water and fertilizer. By removing two ½” plugs 3 ½ inches long, this manual lawn plug aerator and dethacher reduces compaction and thatch to let air, water, and fertilizer down to the root zone. At the same time it stimulates root growth by “pruning” the roots. As an added benefit, the removed cores deposit valuable micro-organisms on the lawn surface. This also strengthens drought and heat tolerance in your turf. The heavy duty powder coated steel handheld lawn corer is built for a lifetime of use.
feature_bullets: REMOVES TWO ½” WIDE 3 ½ INCH GRASS PLUG LAWN CORES, reducing soil compaction and dethatching your lawn while letting air, water and fertilizer get down to the roots of your yard.
REDUCES RUNOFF AND PROMOTES TURF GROWTH. Your lawn will look better with less water and fertilizer.
HAND HELD LAWN AERATOR WITH FOOT BAR FOR EXTRA LEVERAGE. Perfect garden tool for easily aerating smaller yards. Promotes vigorous root growth, strengthening tolerance to drought and heat stress.
BUILT TO LAST Durable steel construction, 37 inch tool height is designed to reduce back strain and make it easy to aerate your whole yard.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,537 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
